reviewText: Holly Hunter - what a daring roll!  Racy, raunchy, real, passionate, gritty.And Earl - you gotta love him - he presents God in a new way.Incredible acting, writing, directing, and a wonderful supporting cast and guest appearances.I watched the entire series on dvd and then purchased the show because it is so great.This strong woman character doesn't take the easy way to exercise life's demons, and still, she has a heart that doesn't stop - this is not a fluff piece - it's a get down into the dregs of your soul kind of show.And, for the record, don't be turned off because God and Angel's are talked about, this is only part of the show.Wonderful risky writing and directing.Thank you for this great show.

reviewText: Saving Grace is a Show that Should have NEVER been Droped, Not Only did it have a Message to it, But it Kept you Thinking and Wondering what was to Happen Next, BUT Since the CLOWNS AT FOX, Thought it was too Costly, They Pulled the Plug on the Show. It Had a High Rating Even When TNT Kept Bouncing the Time around and and Spliting up the season, they Might show 2-3 shows, then wait a Month or 2 before ending the Season, But Bottom Line TNT HAD A HIT SHOW. SO To Me The Show should have a 10 Star Rating, But Sad to Say they Only Go as High as 5 Star. The Cast was GREAT! ALL OF THEM!

reviewText: At first, when my wife described the premise of this series, I could only think, "how stupid". I could not have been more wrong! reviewText: I was very pleased with the series of saving Grace.  I did not know what to expect and I was pleasantly surprised.  This is the best way to view a television series.  No commertials, easy to follow the story line and no waiti;ng until next week to see what happens.  I ordered the last series in advance because I so enjoyed the first two.

reviewText: First I will watch anything Holly Hunter is in, hot little hottie. Piano, Copycat etc....Grace is a out of control- free spirit- partying major crimes detective. Grace can see things at a crime scene that they just miss. She works hard and plays hard so God sends her a second chance Angel to "save" her from herself. Earl (Leon Rippy) is not what you would expect in an angel so it gets really good. Graces lifelong best friend is Rhetta (Laura San Giacomo) who Grace naturally has to tell bout Earl.Oh the reason it was takin off the air was it had good ratings in US so it had to go, because over seas ratings were off.
summary: Why was this show takin off the air?
Title: N/A

reviewText: I've always loved this show, and I think it was here and gone far too quickly.  It's lighthearted at times, and far darker than most TV fare has been before or since.  Holly Hunter is outstanding as a morally compromised cop with issues too numerous to mention.  Her portrayal of this character is stellar, and worthy of more recognition than she ever got while it was on the air.I won't go into the story line much here, but I will say that this entire series is one you won't want to miss, a unique story told by talented writers, brought to life by excellent actors (you've never seen Leon Rippy this good, ever) and filmed at times like you are watching events with your own eyes.  This is the best camera work I've ever seen in a TV series, and the omission of a steady-cam in some scenes makes the action more realistic, without being overdone (like the barely-watchable and highly confusing Cloverfield).Don't miss this, it's well worth your valuable time.
Title: N/A
